# PhysicsEditor (https://www.codeandweb.com/physicseditor) Exporters 

example:

this PhysicsEditor File 

![Screenshot of PhysicsEditor](https://github.com/stoneburner/PhysicsEditorExporters/blob/master/screenshot.png)

will create a swift file like this:

```swift
import SpriteKit

/********************************/
/* This file was autogenerated! */
/********************************/

struct PhysicsBodies {

  enum Body { 
    case banana
    case cherries
    case pineapple
  }

  static func getBody(_ body: Body) -> SKPhysicsBody {
    switch body { 
    case .banana:
        let path = CGMutablePath()
        path.move(to: CGPoint(x: (97 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (128.5 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (89.0 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (119.5 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (93.5 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (104.0 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (91.5 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (90.0 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (74.5 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (57.0 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (61.0 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (45.5 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (40.0 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (37.5 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (3.0 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (34.5 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (-0.5 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (25.0 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (4.0 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (19.5 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (28.0 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (5.5 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (55.0 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (0.5 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (87.0 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (8.5 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (109.5 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (26.0 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (122.0 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (50.5 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (125.5 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (75.0 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (120.0 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (91.5 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (106.5 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (103.0 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (103.5 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (112.0 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (107.5 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (125.0 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.addLine(to: CGPoint(x: (98.0 - 66.0) * 2.0, y: (128.5 - 59.0) * 2.0) )
        path.closeSubpath()
        let body = SKPhysicsBody(polygonFrom: path)
        body.affectedByGravity = false
        body.allowsRotation = true
        body.isDynamic = true
        body.friction = 0.2
        body.linearDamping = 0.100
        body.angularDamping = 0.100
        body.restitution = 0.000
        return body
    case .cherries:
        ...        
    case .pineapple:
        ...
    }
  }
}

```

then you can use the Physicsbodies like this

```
node.physicsBody = PhysicsBodies.getBody(.banana)
```
(note the use of enum to avoid strings here)
